kjv_def: bad, evil, grievous, harm, lewd, malicious, wicked(-ness)
strongs_def: hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from G2556 (πονηρός), which refers rather to essential character, as well as from G4550 (πονηρός), which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt; masculine (singular) the devil, or (plural) sinners
outline:
1. full of labours, annoyances, hardships
    1. pressed and harassed by labours
    2. bringing toils, annoyances, perils; of a time full of peril to Christian faith and steadfastness; causing pain and trouble
  2. bad, of a bad nature or condition
    1. in a physical sense: diseased or blind
    2. in an ethical sense: evil wicked, bad
